preqs: (FIT9130 or FIT5130 or FIT9003 or equivalent) or (MGX5962 and three of (ACF5903, BTF5903, ECF5953, ETF5900, MGF5020, MGF5030, MGX5991, MGX5992 or MKX5955))

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE IN {3341.2, 3343} Do true Otherwise (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT5130, FIT9003, FIT9130} OR  (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {MGX5962} and  Must have passed 3 (I/W) units in {ACF5903, BTF5903, ECF5953, ETF5900, MGF5020, MGF5030, MGX5991, MGX5992, MKX5955} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}))

description: This unit provides students with an understanding of the development and use of information systems that support managers, especially their decision-making tasks. Students will learn of the nature of management work and decision theory and how this affects the development of decision support systems. A number of commonly used decision support methods and techniques will be explored. Students will be introduced to personal decision support systems, group support systems, negotiation support systems, data warehousing, executive information systems and business intelligence.
